body: Removed the tests section.
Hi @tonybaloney, any progress with this? :)

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1110?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [59b44a0...f33345c](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1110?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
The change itself is nice! But it looks like there are unrelated commits?

Yes, I'm not sure why. I made this from the same branch as my previous PR https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/1100, that I thought it was accepted but it appears to be closed and not merged.
That's odd, I checked the apache.org repo and IIRC I saw the changes merged there.

PR #1100 was definitely merged, but since the GitHub repository is only a mirror of the Apache repo, the accepted PRs are declined and the relevant code is pushed to the Apache repository (http://git.apache.org/libcloud.git/) which then appears on GitHub.

Please rebase your change on top of the trunk branch, and ensure you do not push any merge commits.

Thanks.

The change looks good to me, but can you please add corresponding test cases to avoid such regression in the future?
Thanks for your comments pquentin & Kami, I'll get back to you later addressing this suggestions.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/13303756/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/13303756)

Changes Unknown when pulling **55f24e38a15873827fac52cf3527dbc0c54f9b3a on DimensionDataCBUSydney:LIBCLOUD-770_Wait_for_state** into ** on apache:trunk**.
If possible, it would be nice to disable coveralls who keeps posting random comments in old pull requests.
Hi @tonybaloney, yeah sorry for such a big commit. Is there anything I can do to help the review?
@tonybaloney reworked driver to use classes for listener/rule/target group and added docstrings.
hi just a couple of things to edit. please also add a doc page

I think we should do v2.2.1 after the fix is confirmed.

@tonybaloney wdyt?

Fix confirmed - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD-946?focusedCommentId=16172071&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-16172071.

It looks like Travis is having some issues though. Build has been stuck for a long time now.

I went ahead, merged it and added tests (91d14eaa0d54432e0b047e291279a4f6123314b1, 2a8764b1d4dffaf2217a670323b31cef953d1679, 91ea09116afa5b5e969a6a2184c3a68fc192c485) so in can be included in time for v2.2.1 release.

Thanks again.
Thanks Kami!

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1111?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [59b44a0...eafbc11](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1111?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Thank you for your first contribution! Greatly appreciated.

As is documented in http://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/other/changes_in_2_0.html#providing-a-list-of-ca-trusts-is-no-longer-supported, providing a list is no longer supported. While it could be supported, it allowing to append to `libcloud.security.CA_CERTS_PATH` would be misleading. I agree that there were a few places where this was still confusing in the code, so I opened #1114 to this effect. Can you look at it and tell me if it makes sense? Thanks!
@evancarter-iex Not sure what you removed, what I'm saying is that this needs an automated test. Thanks.

I grepped code for `CA_CERTS_PATH` and it looks like there are some other places which also need to be updated - notably the docs.

On a related note - we should also add some code which checks if this variable is not a string (e.g. a list) and throws a user-friendly exception which tells user it needs to be a string and points them to the docs.

@sayap Thank you for your contribution! It has just been merged in trunk.
@fjros Since this was added in #1056, can you please close this PR? It turns out normal libcloud committers can't do this without a commit that asks the PR to be closed. Thanks!
Will merge tomorrow morning, thanks.

Thank you @SElsharkawy, I integrated your changes into trunk.

Next time, please:

 1. Open one pull request per change, or at least change the title of your pull request to explain that you added changes
 1. Don't open a new pull request, but change the existing one, rebasing your commits if necessary

But again, thank you for your contribution! 👍
@pquentin Do I follow this instruction from here https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/development.html. So I need to squash the commits and make a patch?

@mlackman The PR has been merged in trunk, see https://github.com/apache/libcloud/commits. Since the GitHub repository is only a mirror, I pushed in into the Apache repository, which is why the PR is shown as closed.

I'm a new libcloud committer. I guess I should have squashed the commits, but I... forgot about it. Too late now, awnyways.

:+1: 

commits@ is the old one and IIRC, commit notifications also go to notifications@ now, so commits@ one should be obsolete.
Any update on getting this checked in?
@evancarter-iex As said before, you need to add automated tests before this can get checked in. Otherwise this feature can break easily in the future.
@Kami Actually, commits notifications only go to commits@. Should I add it back?
@pquentin I added some tests but I am not that familiar with how you have your stuff setup.
Added
@psachin fixed the tests. Sorry about that

People who have more familiarity with async in Python than us continue to [think about adding sync/async APIs to Python APIs](https://gist.github.com/njsmith/7af696f98272f21294ebd0a7dbf268d4). For exemple, [there's ongoing work on urllib3](https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/pull/1068). When urllib3 is ready, then the work will [start on requests](https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/1390#issuecomment-291781933). At that point we will be in a better position to add an async API. Until then, I think it's not realistic and we should close those two async PRs.
@psachin If you can review the code and say whether you approve the pull request or request changes, it will get this merged faster. Thanks!
@evancarter-iex @psachin Thanks, this has been merged in trunk! ✨
It turns out that https://lists.apache.org/list.html?commits@libcloud.apache.org is an alias of https://lists.apache.org/list.html?notifications@libcloud.apache.org. Merged.

Actually I now see that the code has been merged but the PR has not been closed. I can't do this myself. Can you please close this PR @lmorfitt? Thanks!

Thank you for this @mgogoulos. Unfortunately we can't merge this as-is right now:

 * the pagination in list_nodes is a welcome addition but it needs to be tested (using fixtures for example)
 * as explained by @tetron, the while loops can probably be encapsulated somewhere else by making them bounded and possibly by adding exponential back-off but the should not be simply removed
 * The powerOff is a good one [according to the docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/compute/virtualmachines/virtualmachines-stop).
 * The changes to _to_node make sense. However, I will leave the `pass` on `"ProvisioningState/succeeded"` because on success, the real state will be set later on. This a harmless bug in your PR hidden by the fact that you don't break after setting the state to NodeState.RUNNING. If this was done for another reason, then please tell me.
  * `created_at` use the `time` field, but I see `timeCreated` in the fixtures that seems to be more suited, can you please explain why you're using `time`?

In other words, I plan to:
  * wait for tests before adding pagination
  * add the powerOff change
  * wait to understand time vs timeCreated
  * add ProvisioningState/updating and PowerState/stopped support to _to_node

Thanks for this! I'm glad that you added tests too. ✨ 

Don't you think we should return False when NIC cleanup fails but VHD cleanup succeeds?
@aki-k Any progress on this?
I'll ask my friend to help with the test case creation. Is there some guidance available online from libcloud?

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1121?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [c58e892...a9f17be](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/libcloud/pull/1121?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

@pquentin The abstract interface for a libcloud `Node` just says "True on success and False on failure" but it is not obvious what that should mean in this case.  Perhaps:

* `True` means all resources were either successfully deleted, or returned 404 (in particular, trying to destroy a VM resource that doesn't exist would be considered a success, not a failure)
* `False` means one or more resource deletion actions failed for some other 4xx or 5xx

This would allow a caller to safely invoke destroy_node() in a retry loop until it returns True (assuming the failures are cloud weather that will eventually resolve themselves).  This would allow us to remove the retry loops from destroy_node as well (and document that the caller is responsible for performing retries).

Thank you @r2ronoha for your interest in libcloud. We're happy that you chose this project for your first GitHub contribution! ✨ 

The change itself is nice, thanks! Two things are missing before we can integrate it in libcloud:

* describe the new description parameter in the docstring of `ex_authorize_security_group_ingress`
* add an automated test for the new parameter. I'm happy to hear that you tested it on your AWS integration, but we need an automated test to ensure that your change continues to work in the future. See `test_authorize_security_group_ingress` in `libcloud/test/compute/test_ec2.py` and the corresponding `libcloud/test/compute/fixtures/ec2/authorize_security_group_ingress.xml` fixture.

Make sure to ask for help if anything is unclear.
